climbs.name: Yoder's Bounce test
climbs.fa: Will Koomjian, Alexander Goldman, Jim Yoder, September 2010

content.description: A very fun, well bolted and clean route with a varied set of moves.  The final moves to the anchors has a memorable finish.
content.location: More or less in the middle of the climbing wall, you can identify this route by it climbing right on/beside a sharp arete in the middle of the route and the visible anchors from the ground.

content.description: This route would be decent for a new trad climber as the rock is pretty good for Victoria tower. The actual climbing is no more than 20 feet. The feet and hands are excellent. No crack technique is needed and you get gear whenever you want. The finish is literally walking up a 3rd class ramp to the anchor. There is some loose rock on the ramp so be careful not to rain on your belayer.
content.protection: Gear to 3”. Sport anchor w/ quick links.
content.location: 20’ right of Oh Oh Climax. Pass through a small corridor between the wall and a large boulder to a right facing dihedral That’s kinda hidden from view.

content.description: A basic, somewhat gritty and dirty route. Route just to the right of Purple Moon.
content.protection: Bolted, with chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Located at left of Safe Zone (the Arete climb)

climbs.name: Purple Moon
climbs.fa: Alexander Goldman, Will Koomjian, Jim Yoder, September 2010

content.description: Just about as pleasant and inviting as a 6$ bottle of wine from TJ's. Crux midway up, traverse left under a large crack, (you can place a #3 here if you want, but it's absolutely not needed) then pull up onto the pedestal to finish
content.location: Left most route at the crag.

content.description: Slightly long reaches to good holds on sub par rock. Crux is just before you enter the shallow right leaning groove. Easy climbing to anchor. Use a directional for TR. rock should improve over time as with most smith routes.
content.location: The rightmost bolted route on Victoria tower.

climbs.name: Mossy Boobs
climbs.fa: Bolted by Jim Yoder, FA by Julia Ju

content.description:
Good 5.8 climbing that leads to an overhanging wall of pockets to pull.  Options on the overhang are limitless, though some pockets are better than others.   

  A well bolted route and worth climbing if in the area.  It's a shame the overhanging section isn't longer.
content.protection: 8 bolts.  2 bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Just to the right of The Safe Zone.  Look for a series of bolts that climbs up and past a very large hueco and leads into an overhanging honeycomb like section at the top near the anchor.

content.description:
Easy climbing on less than stellar rock. Route finding is a little adventurous but not advanced. 

Pitch 1: From the bolt, shoot up the dihedral on gear till you top the little spire. Rap down the notch and walk over to the far side of said notch. Anchor. 

Pitch 2: Move up and around to the north side following a couple bolts. Scramble up the Choss pile till you summit! Sick Bra!! 

If you can tolerate the poor rock, this climb is alpine style fun.
content.protection: Mixed to 4”. Two rope rap from final anchors down the south side or reverse the route with one.
content.location: Hike up the north gully until you reach the backside of the formation, then head slightly down the south gully until you get to a ledge with a bolt on it to your left. Expect to see the ledge very quickly when headed downhill.

content.description:
One of the several towers in the Monument area, Victoria Tower hosts a small handful of solid moderate routes.  Due to its location, it rarely sees traffic and may be a good destination for crowded Smith weekends.  

  Established routes tend to be cleaner than the more recently bolted routes and some hollow / loose holds may exist on the very recently bolted lines.   

  Gets morning sun and afternoon shade.
